tasks.subject: Python

tasks.action: Write the `for` loop to iterate through data and update weights.

tasks.action: Andrew Ng Week 2: Multiple Features, Vectorization, and Normal Equation.

tasks.action: Handle missing values in Housing Data (Fill with Mean vs Drop). Apply your scaling function.

tasks.action: Andrew Ng Week 2: Polynomial Features. How to fit curves instead of lines.

tasks.action: Andrew Ng Week 3: Classification vs Regression. The Sigmoid Function.

tasks.action: Andrew Ng Week 3: Understanding Linear vs Non-Linear boundaries.

tasks.action: Create a scatter plot of data. Manually draw a line `x1 + x2 - 5 = 0` to separate classes.

tasks.action: Visualize Survival rates by Gender and Class using Seaborn countplots.

tasks.action: Andrew Ng Week 3: Why MSE fails for Classification. The Log Loss formula.

tasks.action: Convert Categorical variables (Sex, Embarked) into numbers (0/1) manually.

tasks.action: Solve 'Course Schedule'. Detect cycles in a Directed Graph (Topological Sort).

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Andrew Ng Course 5 Week 4: Self-Attention. Query, Key, Value vectors explained.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Write the formula: $Attention(Q, K, V) = softmax(\frac{QK^T}{\sqrt{d_k}})V$.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Write a `SelfAttention` class from scratch using just Matrix Multiplication.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Check: Why do we divide by $\sqrt{d_k}$? (To prevent vanishing gradients in Softmax).

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Graph Valid Tree'. Use Union-Find or DFS to detect cycles and connectivity.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Andrew Ng Course 5 Week 4: Why multiple heads? (Attending to different subspaces).

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Write formula: $MultiHead(Q,K,V) = Concat(head_1, ..., head_h)W^O$.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Implement `MultiHeadAttention` class. Split heads, attend, then concatenate.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Learn `torch.einsum`. Rewrite matrix multiplications using Einstein notation.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Word Search'. Use Backtracking (DFS on grid).

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Andrew Ng Course 5 Week 4: Why Transformers need position info (No recurrence). Sine/Cosine waves.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Visualize $PE_{(pos, 2i)} = \sin(pos/10000^{2i/d_{model}})$. Plot the heatmap.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Implement `PositionalEncoding` module. Add it to your word embeddings.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Understand 'Look-ahead Mask'. Why the decoder cannot see future tokens.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Network Delay Time'. Implement Dijkstra's Algorithm using a Min-Heap.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Andrew Ng Course 5 Week 4: Encoder vs Decoder stacks. Feed Forward Networks.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Write the layer update: $LayerNorm(x + Sublayer(x))$.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Assemble `EncoderLayer` and `TransformerEncoder`. You now have a mini-BERT.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Check: Why do we use LayerNorm instead of BatchNorm in NLP? (Sequence length varies).

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Word Ladder'. Use BFS to find the shortest transformation path.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Andrew Ng/Papers: Bidirectional Encoder Representations. Masked LM & Next Sentence Prediction.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Write the loss: $\sum -\log P(x_{mask} | x_{context})$. Why bidirectional context helps.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Load `bert-base-uncased` from Hugging Face. Fine-tune on IMDB for classification.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Create an account. Upload your fine-tuned model using `push_to_hub()`.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Alien Dictionary' (Hard). Topological Sort on character dependencies.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Andrew Ng/Papers: Generative Pre-trained Transformer. Causal Masking (Future blinding).

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Calculate Perplexity: $PP(W) = P(w_1...w_N)^{-1/N}$. Lower is better.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Load `gpt2`. Generate text prompts. Experiment with `top_k` and `top_p` (Nucleus) sampling.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Compare BPE (GPT) vs WordPiece (BERT). `tokenizer.decode(ids)` to see subwords.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Redundant Connection'. Use Union-Find to detect the extra edge in a tree.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Pre-training (Expensive) vs Fine-tuning (Cheap). The ULMFiT paper.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Understand why fine-tuning too much can make the model forget language syntax.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Wrap your Sentiment Model in a `FastAPI` app. Endpoint `/predict` takes text, returns sentiment.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Check: Why can't BERT generate text well? (It sees the future tokens during training).

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Implement Trie (Prefix Tree)'. Crucial for autocomplete and search.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Retrieve -> Augment -> Generate. Why RAG beats fine-tuning for factual queries.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $Score(q, d) = Enc(q) \cdot Enc(d)$. Using Bi-Encoders for fast search.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Create a simple Vector DB using `numpy` and `cosine_similarity`. Index 100 Wikipedia snippets.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Learn `faiss` (Facebook AI Similarity Search). Index 1M vectors and search in ms.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Word Search II'. Combine Backtracking (DFS) with a Trie. Hard but rewarding.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Fixed-size vs Semantic Chunking. The 'Lost in the Middle' phenomenon.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Write function `chunk_text(text, size=500, overlap=50)`. Ensure context isn't cut.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Ingest your `Sampath_CV.pdf`. Chunk it. Retrieve 'What did Sampath do at ISRO?'.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Use `RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter`. Compare its output to your manual chunker.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Design Search Autocomplete System'. Use Trie + Priority Queue (Top K hot).

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Combining Dense (Vector) + Sparse (BM25/Keyword) search. Reciprocal Rank Fusion.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Understand TF-IDF vs BM25. Why BM25 saturates term frequency.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Implement a Cross-Encoder (Re-ranker). Re-sort the top 10 vector results for accuracy.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Check: Why is Bi-Encoder fast but Cross-Encoder accurate? (O(N) vs O(N^2) interactions).

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Number of Connected Components in an Undirected Graph'. Union-Find standard.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: 'ReAct: Synergizing Reasoning and Acting in Language Models'. Thought-Act-Obs loop.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Design a system prompt: 'You are an agent. You have access to tools. Format: Thought, Action, Input.'

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Write a `while` loop in Python that parses LLM output, regex matches `Action:`, and executes it.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Master regex to extract `Action: Search[query]` from a text blob.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Cheapest Flights Within K Stops'. Bellman-Ford or BFS. Graph theory depth.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: OpenAI `functions` API vs standard prompting. How JSON schema guides the model.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Write a JSON schema for a calculator tool: `{"name": "add", "parameters": {...}}`.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Build an agent that can answer 'What is the weather in Bangalore?' by calling a mock API.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Debug the `tool_calls` response object in the OpenAI ChatCompletion API.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Min Cost to Connect All Points'. Prim's or Kruskal's Algorithm (MST).

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: CrewAI/AutoGen. Manager Agent vs Worker Agents. Delegation patterns.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Calculate token costs. If history grows to 32k tokens, how do we summarize memory?

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Build an agent that searches Wikipedia, summarizes 3 pages, and writes a report to a file.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Check: Why do agents get stuck in loops? (Hallucination of tool outputs).

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Reconstruct Itinerary'. Hierholzer's Algorithm (Eulerian path in Graph).

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: 'An Image is Worth 16x16 Words'. How to treat image patches as text tokens.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: Flatten $16 \times 16 \times 3$ patch $\rightarrow$ Linear Layer $\rightarrow$ Vector $D$.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Implement the `PatchEmbedding` layer in PyTorch. Pass a dummy image through it.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Learn `einops`. `rearrange(img, 'b c (h p1) (w p2) -> b (h w) (p1 p2 c)', p1=16, p2=16)`.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Min Cost to Connect All Points'. Prim's Algorithm for MST.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Forward process (add noise) vs Reverse process (predict noise). DDPM paper.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $q(x_t | x_{t-1}) = \mathcal{N}(x_t; \sqrt{1-\beta_t}x_{t-1}, \beta_t I)$.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Train a tiny U-Net to remove noise from MNIST digits. (Simplest Diffusion demo).

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Run `StableDiffusionPipeline`. Generate 'A futuristic city by Van Gogh'.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Swim in Rising Water'. Dijkstra's Algorithm with a Min-Heap grid traversal.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: Low-Rank Adaptation. Fine-tuning big models with tiny matrices $A \times B$.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Why is $d \times r + r \times d$ much smaller than $d \times d$? (if $r=4, d=4096$).

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Implement a `LoRALayer` class that wraps a Linear layer. Freeze original weights.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Check: Why does Diffusion take so long? (Iterative denoising steps).

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Cheapest Flights Within K Stops' again using Bellman-Ford. Handle negative weights.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: vLLM. Why Key-Value caching runs out of GPU memory. How Paging fixes it.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Calculate inference cost: Tokens/sec is bounded by Memory Bandwidth, not Compute.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Install `vLLM`. Serve a small model (e.g., `opt-125m`) as an OpenAI-compatible API server.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Load test your API. How many concurrent requests until it crashes?

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: Solve 'Find the City With the Smallest Number of Neighbors'. Floyd-Warshall Algorithm ($O(N^3)$).

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: GPTQ vs AWQ vs GGUF. Reducing 16-bit floats to 4-bit integers.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $x_{q} = round(x/scale + zero)$. Calculate the error for $x=0.53$.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Download a GGUF model (Llama-3-8B-Instruct). Run it on CPU using `llama.cpp`.

tasks.action: Install LM Studio. Compare the speed (tok/s) of q4_k_m vs fp16.

tasks.action: Solve 'Accounts Merge'. Use Union-Find to group emails belonging to the same user.

tasks.action: Concept: ROUGE/BLEU (N-gram overlap) vs LLM-as-a-Judge (GPT-4 grading).

tasks.action: Calculate Longest Common Subsequence between 'The cat is on the mat' and 'The cat is mat'.

tasks.action: Use `ragas` library to evaluate your RAG pipeline (Faithfulness, Answer Relevancy).

tasks.action: Check: Why is Perplexity a bad metric for Chatbots? (It measures prediction, not quality).

tasks.action: Solve 'Course Schedule II'. Return the ordering, not just boolean. Detect cycles.

tasks.action: Concept: Image vs Container. Layers. Why 'it works on my machine' is solved.

tasks.action: Calculate RAM needs: Model Size (FP16) + Context Window + Batch Overhead.

tasks.action: Solve 'Parallel Courses'. Topological Sort + Level counting (BFS).

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Pods, Deployments, Services. Scaling horizontally based on CPU load.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Understand HPA formula: $desiredReplicas = \lceil currentReplicas \times ( currentMetric / desiredMetric ) \rceil$.

tasks.action: Re-solve 'Alien Dictionary'. This is a common Hard interview question.

tasks.action: Concept: CI/CD for ML. GitHub Actions -> Build Docker -> Push to Registry -> Deploy.

tasks.action: Understand versioning logic: v1.0 (accuracy 85%) vs v1.1 (accuracy 87%). Rollback.

tasks.action: Check: Why do we use Kubernetes instead of just Docker Compose in production? (Self-healing).

tasks.action: Design: How to distribute keys across N servers so adding a server only moves K/N keys.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Message Passing. Nodes aggregate information from neighbors. Permutation Invariance.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $A$ (Adjacency) and $D$ (Degree). Why $AX$ propagates features one step.

tasks.action: System Design: Token Bucket vs Leaky Bucket algorithms. Redis implementation.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: Semi-Supervised Classification with GCNs (Kipf & Welling). The Renormalization Trick.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Calculate $\tilde{D}^{-1/2} \tilde{A} \tilde{D}^{-1/2}$. Why this keeps gradients stable.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Train a GCN on the Cora citation network. Classify papers by topic.

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Understand `torch.sparse_coo_tensor`. Storing massive graphs efficiently.

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: System Design: Round Robin, Least Connections, IP Hash. Layer 4 vs Layer 7 balancing.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: Inductive Representation Learning. Sampling neighbors vs using full graph.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Compare Mean, LSTM, and Pooling aggregators. $h_v^k = \sigma(W \cdot CONCAT(h_v^{k-1}, h_{N(v)}^k))$.

tasks.action: Train GraphSAGE to predict missing edges (e.g., 'Will user A follow user B?').

tasks.action: Check: Why are GCNs transductive but GraphSAGE is inductive? (Can it handle new nodes?).

tasks.subject: DSA
tasks.action: System Design: CAP Theorem. Consistency vs Availability vs Partition Tolerance. DynamoDB architecture.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: GATs. Using Attention to weigh neighbor importance (like Transformers for Graphs).

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $\alpha_{ij} = softmax(LeakyReLU(a^T [Wh_i || Wh_j]))$. Why LeakyReLU is used here.

tasks.action: Switch your GCN code to `GATConv`. Compare accuracy on Cora. Does attention help?

tasks.action: Visualize the attention weights on the graph edges. Which nodes are 'influencers'?

tasks.action: System Design: Database Sharding. Range-based vs Hash-based sharding. Handling hotspots.

tasks.action: Concept: User-Item Matrix. Matrix Factorization (SVD). The Netflix Prize approach.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: Decomposing $R \approx U \Sigma V^T$. Latent factors (users like 'action', movies are 'action').

tasks.action: Understand heuristics for new users (Popularity based, Demographic based).

tasks.action: System Design: Replication (Master-Slave). Fan-out on Write vs Fan-out on Read.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: NCF. Replacing the dot product with a Neural Network to learn non-linear interactions.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: Binary Cross Entropy ($-\sum y \log \hat{y}$). Treating 'clicked' as 1, 'not clicked' as 0.

tasks.action: Implement NCF in PyTorch (Embedding layers + MLP). Train on MovieLens Implicit data.

tasks.action: Check: Why is Matrix Factorization linear but NCF non-linear? (NCF captures complex tastes).

tasks.action: System Design: Memcached/Redis. Eviction policies (LRU/LFU). Consistent Hashing recap.

tasks.action: Paper: MAE (He et al.). Masking 75% of image patches and reconstructing pixels.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $\frac{1}{N} \sum (x_{original} - x_{reconstructed})^2$. Only calculate loss on masked patches.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Write a `MaskedAutoencoderViT` class. Visualize the reconstruction of a masked dog.

tasks.action: System Design: Kafka/RabbitMQ. Pub/Sub model. Exactly-once delivery semantics.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: SimCLR. Maximizing agreement between augmented views of the same image.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $-\log \frac{\exp(sim(z_i, z_j)/\tau)}{\sum \exp(sim(z_i, z_k)/\tau)}$. The temperature $\tau$.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Train SimCLR on CIFAR-10. Use strong augmentations (Color Jitter, Gaussian Blur).

tasks.action: System Design: iOS/Android Push. Rate limiting per user. Priority queues.

tasks.action: Paper: OpenAI CLIP. Learning visual concepts from natural language supervision.

tasks.action: Math: Image-to-Text loss + Text-to-Image loss. Dual encoders.

tasks.action: Check: Why does CLIP generalize better than ImageNet models? (Learns concepts, not just labels).

tasks.action: System Design: Object Storage. Metadata DB vs Block Storage. Erasure Coding.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Paper: Auto-Encoding Variational Bayes. Learning a smooth latent space $z$.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: Evidence Lower Bound. Reconstruction Loss + KL Divergence (Regularization).

tasks.action: Train a VAE on CelebA. Interpolate between two faces in the latent space.

tasks.action: System Design: URL Frontier. Politeness delay. Deduplication (Bloom Filters).

tasks.action: Paper: GAN (Goodfellow). Generator vs Discriminator. The Minimax Game.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $\min_G \max_D V(D, G) = \mathbb{E}[\log D(x)] + \mathbb{E}[\log(1 - D(G(z)))]$.

tasks.action: Train a Deep Convolutional GAN on Anime faces. Watch the generator improve.

tasks.action: Log your GAN images to `wandb`. Detect mode collapse early.

tasks.action: System Design: Trie service. Top-k caching. Updating frequency counts.

tasks.action: Paper: Image-to-Image Translation. Conditioning on an input image (Edges -> Photo).

tasks.action: Math: Adding L1 loss $||y - G(x, z)||_1$ to force the output to match the target structure.

tasks.action: Check: Why is VAE blurry but GAN sharp? (MSE/L2 loss averages pixels, GAN doesn't).

tasks.action: System Design: Redis Sorted Sets (ZSET). High-scale score updates. Rank retrieval.

tasks.action: Concept: States, Actions, Rewards. The Bellman Equation. $V(s) = max_a (R + \gamma V(s'))$.

tasks.action: Paper: Playing Atari with Deep RL (DeepMind). Using a Neural Net to approximate the Q-table.

tasks.subject: Project
tasks.action: Implement a simple DQN agent to balance the pole. Watch the loss curve vs reward curve.

tasks.action: Concept: Optimizing the policy $\pi(a|s)$ directly instead of the Q-value. The basis of PPO.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $\nabla J(\theta) = \mathbb{E}[\nabla \log \pi_\theta(a|s) \cdot R]$. The 'Likelihood Ratio' trick.

tasks.action: Check: Why is RL unstable? (Moving target problem—we train on data generated by the model itself).

tasks.action: System Design: Twitter Snowflake (Time + Machine + Sequence). Why UUID is bad for DB Indexing.

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Data Parallel vs Model Parallel. Gradient Synchronization (All-Reduce).

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: $Batch_{eff} = Batch_{per\_gpu} \times N_{gpus} \times Accumulation_{steps}$.

tasks.action: Simulate large batch training on 1 GPU: `loss = loss / accum_steps; loss.backward()`.

tasks.subject: ML Math

tasks.subject: Project

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: Adding noise $\sim Lap(0, b)$ to gradients to hide individual data points.

tasks.action: Check: Why do we need a Feature Store? (To prevent leakage and ensure consistency).

tasks.action: System Design: CDN logic. Video transcoding (DAG of tasks). Adaptive bitrate streaming (HLS).

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Concept: Batch (Cheap) vs Real-time (Expensive) vs Streaming. Shadow Deployment.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Math: Estimate RPS. If model takes 100ms, 1 GPU = 10 RPS. Need 1000 RPS? Need 100 GPUs.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Quantify your resume: 'Improved accuracy by 15%' or 'Reduced latency from 500ms to 200ms'.

tasks.subject: Project

tasks.subject: Tools

tasks.subject: DSA

tasks.subject: ML Theory
tasks.action: Review: Connection between Logistic Regression -> Neural Net -> Transformer -> Agent.

tasks.subject: ML Math
tasks.action: Take a breath. You just completed 90 days of rigorous math. Congratulations.

tasks.subject: Project

tasks.subject: Tools
tasks.action: Apply to 5 'Reach' companies. You are now ready. Good luck, Sampath.
